billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CORPORATIONS, AUTHORITIES AND COMMISSIONS

title: Eliminates certain publication requirements for limited liability companies and limited liability partnerships; repealer
summary: Eliminates the requirement that limited liability companies publish their articles of organization and that limited liability partnerships publish their registrations.

       Introduced  by  Sen. KRUEGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Corporations,  Authorities

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  limited  liability company law and the arts and
         cultural affairs law, in relation to publication requirements; and  to
         repeal  section  206 of the limited liability company law, relating to
         affidavits of publication

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The opening paragraph of subdivision (e) of section 1006 of
    2  the limited liability company law, as amended by chapter 375 of the laws
    3  of 1998, is amended to read as follows:
    4    In  connection  with  any conversion approved under subdivision (c) of
    5  this section, the partnership or limited partnership shall file with the
    6  department of  state  a  signed  certificate  entitled  "Certificate  of
    7  Conversion of ... (name partnership or limited partnership) to ... (name
    8  of  limited  liability  company)  under  section one thousand six of the
    9  Limited Liability Company Law" [and shall also satisfy  the  publication
   10  requirements  of  section two hundred six of this chapter]. Such certif-
   11  icate shall include either:
   12    S 2. Section 206 of the limited liability company law is REPEALED.
   13    S 3. Subdivision (s) of section 1101 of the limited liability  company
   14  law,  as  amended by chapter 767 of the laws of 2005, is amended to read
   15  as follows:
   16    (s) For filing a certificate of publication with affidavits of  publi-
   17  cation  annexed  thereto  pursuant  to  section [two hundred six,] eight
   18  hundred two, twelve hundred three or thirteen hundred six of this  chap-
   19  ter, fifty dollars.
   20    S  4.  Section  209 of the limited liability company law is amended to
   21  read as follows:

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00495-01-1

       S. 437                              2

    1    S 209. Filing with the department  of  state.  A  signed  articles  of
    2  organization  and  any  signed certificate of amendment or other certif-
    3  icates filed pursuant to this chapter  or  of  any  judicial  decree  of
    4  amendment or cancellation shall be delivered to the department of state.
    5  If  the  instrument  that  is  delivered  to the department of state for
    6  filing complies as to form with the requirements of law and  the  filing
    7  fee  required  by  any statute of this state in connection therewith has
    8  been paid, the instrument shall be filed and indexed by  the  department
    9  of  state.  The  department  of  state shall not review such articles or
   10  certificates for legal sufficiency;  its  review  shall  be  limited  to
   11  determining  that  the  form has been completed. THE DEPARTMENT OF STATE
   12  SHALL PROMULGATE RULES AND REGULATIONS FOR THE ON-LINE  FILING  OF  SUCH
   13  ARTICLES  OR  CERTIFICATES FILED PURSUANT TO THIS CHAPTER OR SUCH AMEND-
   14  MENT OR CANCELLATION THEREOF.
   15    S 5. Section 1101 of the limited liability company law is  amended  by
   16  adding a new subdivision (w) to read as follows:
   17    (W)  FOR THE ON-LINE FILING OF ANY DOCUMENTS REQUIRED TO BE FILED WITH
   18  THE DEPARTMENT PURSUANT TO THIS CHAPTER, FIFTY DOLLARS.
   19    S 6. Subdivisions (a-1) and  (e-1)  of  section  102  of  the  limited
   20  liability company law, subdivision (a-1) as amended by chapter 44 of the
   21  laws  of  2006 and subdivision (e-1) as added by chapter 767 of the laws
   22  of 2005, are amended to read as follows:
   23    (a-1) "Affidavit of publication" means the affidavit of the printer or
   24  publisher of a newspaper in which a  publication  pursuant  to  sections
   25  [two  hundred  six,]  eight hundred two, one thousand two hundred three,
   26  and one thousand three hundred six of this chapter has  been  made.  The
   27  affidavit of publication shall be in a form substantially as follows:
   28    "Affidavit  of  Publication  Under  Section        (specify applicable
   29  section) of the Limited Liability Company Law
   30  State of New York,
   31  County of ________, ss.:
   32    The undersigned is the printer (or publisher) of ______________  (name
   33  of  newspaper),  a  _________  (daily  or weekly) newspaper published in
   34  ________________, New York. A notice regarding _______________ (name  of
   35  limited  liability company) was published in said newspaper once in each
   36  week for six successive weeks, commencing on __________  and  ending  on
   37  ________.  The  text  of the notice as published in said newspaper is as
   38  set forth below, or in the annexed  exhibit.  This  newspaper  has  been
   39  designated by the Clerk of ________ County for this purpose.
   40                                                ____________ (signature)
   41                                                __________(printed name),
   42                                               (jurat)"
   43    The  text  of  the notice set forth in or annexed to each affidavit of
   44  publication shall: (i) include only the text of  the  published  notice,
   45  (ii)  be free of extraneous marks, and (iii) if submitted in paper form,
   46  be printed on paper of such size, weight and color, and in ink  of  such
   47  color,  and  in  such  font, and be in such other qualities and form not
   48  inconsistent with any other provision of law as, in the judgment of  the
   49  secretary  of  state,  will  not impair the ability of the department of
   50  state to include a legible and permanent copy thereof  in  its  official
   51  records. Nothing in this subdivision shall be construed as requiring the
   52  department  of  state to accept for filing a document submitted in elec-
   53  tronic form.
   54    (e-1) "Certificate of publication" means a  certificate  presented  on
   55  behalf  of the applicable limited liability company to the department of
   56  state together with the affidavits of publication  pursuant  to  section

       S. 437                              3

    1  [two hundred six,] eight hundred two, one thousand two hundred three, or
    2  one  thousand  three  hundred  six  of  this chapter. The certificate of
    3  publication shall be in a form substantially as follows:
    4    "Certificate  of  Publication  of  ______  (name  of limited liability
    5  company) Under Section ______ (specify applicable section) of the Limit-
    6  ed Liability Company Law
    7    The undersigned is the  _________  (title)  of  ___________  (name  of
    8  limited  liability  company).  The  published  notices  described in the
    9  annexed  affidavits  of  publication  contain  all  of  the  information
   10  required by the above-mentioned section of the Limited Liability Company
   11  Law.  The newspapers described in such affidavits of publication satisfy
   12  the requirements set forth in the Limited Liability Company Law and  the
   13  designation made by the county clerk. I certify the foregoing statements
   14  to be true under penalties of perjury.
   15                                               Date
   16                                               Signature
   17                                               Printed Name"
   18    S  7.  Subdivision 4 of section 23.03 of the arts and cultural affairs
   19  law, as amended by chapter 767 of the laws of 2005, is amended  to  read
   20  as follows:
   21    4.  A  limited  partnership that is a theatrical production company is
   22  exempt from the requirement for publishing  its  certificate  or  notice
   23  under sections ninety-one, 121-201 and 121-902 of the partnership law so
   24  long  as  the  words "limited partnership" appear in its name. A limited
   25  liability company that is a theatrical production company is exempt from
   26  the requirement for publishing its articles of organization, application
   27  for authority  or  a  notice  containing  the  substance  thereof  under
   28  [sections  two hundred six and] SECTION eight hundred two of the limited
   29  liability company law so long as the words "limited  liability  company"
   30  appear in its name.
   31    S 8. This act shall take effect immediately.
